required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: High-dose Etoposide Could Discriminate Patients With Refractory/Relapsed Lymphoma Benefit From APBSCT
clinical_study.official_title: 2008 WHO Myeloid and Lymphocytic Tumor Diagnostic Criteria
clinical_study.source: Shanghai General Hospital, Shanghai Jiao Tong University School of Medicine

brief_summary.textblock: patients with refractory /relapsed lymphoma received high-dose etoposide for hematopoietic stem cell (HSC) mobilization.All patients received high-dose etoposide 20-25 mg/kg/d intravenously for two consecutive days followed by rhG-CSF10ug/kg/day subcutaneously at 48 hours after chemotherapy; rhG-CSF was continued until the end of harvesting for HSCs/HPCs. Peripheral blood counts were performed daily for all patients following the initiating of rhG-CSF. Leukapheresis was performed when peripheral blood white blood count exceeded 4Ã—109/L with blood cell The harvested cells reached at least 2*108/kg for mononuclear cells and/or 2*106/kg for CD34+ cells with once to twice leukapheresis. The final product was kept frozen in liquid nitrogen.Auto-PBSCT

intervention.description: an epipodophyllotoxin, is one of the most common chemotherapy agents for lymphoma without reciprocal resistance with other kinds of agents.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- relapsed/refractory lymphoma ,siut APBSCT
Exclusion Criteria:
- bone marrow without involvement by lymphoma cells

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Shanghai General Hospital, Shanghai Jiao Tong University School of Medicine

clinical_study.keyword: high-dose etoposide,autologous peripheral blood stem cell transplantation
